content: I'm currently working with Python and I need to convert .jpg images to .png. I have looked around and read through the Python documentation but I couldn't find a solution. Are there any packages available in Python that can help me with this conversion?

Yes, you can use the Python Imaging Library (PIL), which is now maintained under the name Pillow, to convert .jpg images to .png format. Pillow is a very popular library for image processing in Python and provides extensive capabilities for opening, manipulating, and saving many different image file formats. Here’s a simple example of how you can use Pillow to convert a .jpg image to .png:

First, you need to install the Pillow library if you haven't already. You can do this using pip:

```bash
pip install Pillow
```

Once you have Pillow installed, you can use the following script to convert a .jpg image to a .png image:

```python
from PIL import Image

# Open the .jpg image
jpg_image = Image.open('path/to/your/image.jpg')

# Convert and save as a .png image
jpg_image.save('path/to/save/image.png', 'PNG')
```

Make sure to replace `'path/to/your/image.jpg'` with the path to your .jpg image and `'path/to/save/image.png'` with the desired path where you want to save your .png image.

This script opens the .jpg image, and then saves it as a .png image, effectively converting the format. Pillow automatically handles the format conversion when saving the file with a different extension.
